meanings.definition: Patient or tolerant in the face of provocation
meanings.sent1: She remained forbearing even when her little brother kept teasing her.
meanings.sent2: The forbearing teacher calmly handled the disruptive students in the classroom.
meanings.sent3: Despite the constant noise, the forbearing librarian continued to help everyone find books.
meanings.sent4: Her forbearing nature was like a shield against the harsh words thrown at her.
meanings.sent5: The forbearing smile on her face never wavered, no matter the situation.

meanings.sent1: He displayed a forbearing attitude when dealing with the difficult customer.
meanings.sent2: The forbearing driver stayed calm despite the heavy traffic and delays.
meanings.sent3: The forbearing cat resisted the temptation to pounce on the moving toy.
meanings.sent4: In the face of chaos, her forbearing demeanor shone like a beacon of peace.
meanings.sent5: His forbearing response to criticism impressed everyone around him.

meanings.definition: Refraining from enforcing a right or claim
meanings.sent1: The company decided to be forbearing and not pursue legal action against the competitor.
meanings.sent2: She was forbearing in her decision not to demand repayment of the borrowed money.
meanings.sent3: The forbearing landlord allowed the tenant extra time to pay the rent.
meanings.sent4: By forbearing his rights, he hoped to maintain a good relationship with his neighbor.
meanings.sent5: The forbearing act of forgiveness brought peace to the long-standing dispute.
